narrative=Sarah Carroll, who has a history of trauma, was last seen by a friend volunteering at a community center near Bruce Street, Alloa. Concern grew when she failed to return to the rehab center for her scheduled session. Her grandmother, Sharon Williams, contacted the police.

narrative=Sarah Carroll, who has a history of trauma, was last seen by a friend near Earl's Road, Grangemouth. She reportedly visited Sharon Williams at West Lodge Gardens, Alloa, before going missing. Police later traced her to Kenilworth Drive.

narrative=Sarah Carroll, who has a history of trauma, was last seen in the vicinity of a casino on Ercall Road, Brightons, FK2 0RJ, accompanied by her colleague, Samuel Pearson. Her disappearance followed an unsettling encounter on the casino floor, leading her to leave abruptly. She was later found wandering disoriented in a field near 1 Arnothill, Falkirk, FK1 5RY, where she was traced by the police after being reported missing for several hours.

narrative=Sarah Carroll was last seen near her home at 1 Garrison Place, Falkirk. Her disappearance was reported by her mother after failing to show up for a planned lunch at the community center. Earlier that day, Sarah had spoken with her colleague about arranging a book club meet in Dunhalin, Rumford. Concerns arose due to her disability, raising worries about her ability to navigate alone. Abigail Carroll, a relative, reached out to the authorities when Sarah didn't respond to calls. After a thorough search, Sarah was located safely in Stirling, much to the relief of her family and friends. Police determined she had wandered off unintentionally, but was unharmed.

narrative=Sarah Carroll was reported missing after failing to meet her friend at Park Avenue. With a history of trauma, she left home and was later found by her worried mother in a field near Kemper Avenue, Falkirk. Her disappearance prompted a high-risk search by family and authorities.

narrative=Sarah Carroll was reported missing from 1 Garrison Place, Falkirk, where she resided. With a history of trauma, she had been attending a physical therapy clinic at 88 High Station Road, Falkirk, near the rehab center where she often sought support. Her friend, Julie Palmer, expressed concern after losing contact post-session. Given her vulnerable state and reliance on structured care, authorities elevated the urgency. After an extensive search, she was found unharmed by police on Kemper Avenue, enabling a safe return to her residence.
